neutral.name: Neutral Space
neutral.desc: This space can be freely traversed and have no additional effects.

shop.name: Shop
shop.desc: A player who lands on this space receives a random item, if there is room in the player's inventory.

altar.name: Altar
altar.desc: A player on this space is allowed to make one wish. At the end of the turn, all players who made wishes have their wishes granted and then are returned to Start. Multiple players on this space do not engage in combat.

start.name: Start Square
start.desc: All new players start on this square. Players sharing this space do not fight, and any player on this space does not lose HP for any reason. A player who ends his turn on Start is cured of any status ailments.

gap.name: Empty Gap
gap.desc: These spaces are ordinarily impassible to players. If a player is forced onto a gap, they immediately return to Start and loses 5 HP. A player who is adjacent to a gap can choose to leap into the gap.

crumbled.name: Crumbled Space
crumbled.desc: When a player steps off this space, it crumbles and disappears. Any item on this space is removed from the game board when it does so.

water.name: Water Space
water.desc: A player who moves onto this space must stop here.

whirl.name: Whirlpool Space
whirl.visual: blue space with watery texture and light blue swirl
whirl.desc: A player who stops here moves in counterclockwise order to the next Whirlpool Space. This space is also treated as a Water Space.

bowser.name: Bowser Space
bowser.visual: dark red space with Bowser space icon
bowser.desc: A player who lands on this space will suffer a penalty as decided by Mercerenies. After triggering, this space has a 50% chance of turning back into whatever space it was before it was Bowser.

rconvey.name: Conveyer Belt (Right)
rconvey.visual: pink space with black right arrows
rconvey.desc: Every token, player, and item that ends on this space moves one space to the right. If this conveyer pushes an item off the map, it disappears. If this conveyer pushes a player off, they suffer the usual penalty for falling off the board.

lconvey.name: Conveyer Belt (Left)
lconvey.visual: pink space with black left arrows
lconvey.desc: Every token, player, and item that ends on this space moves one space to the left. If this conveyer pushes an item off the map, it disappears. If this conveyer pushes a player off, they suffer the usual penalty for falling off the board.

heavysteps.name: Heavy Steps
heavysteps.desc: Single use. On the turn you use this item, every space you move off of will crumble as though it was a Crumbled Space.

bowserrep.name: Bowser Repellent
bowserrep.desc: Single use. This item activates automatically when you land on a Bowser Space. The Bowser Space is revealed but has no effect.

soulshoes.name: Soul Shoes
soulshoes.desc: MOV is halved (rounded down). You may move further than your MOV by spending 1 HP per additional space you'd like to move.

item.name: Item
item.desc: Icon used to represent items on the map.

goldcoin.name: Gold Coin
goldcoin.desc: Can be picked up by a player. Always protected from wishes.

holly.name: Mr. Hollywood
holly.desc: Moves around the board randomly, giving gifts to anyone he encounters. The gifts may be good or bad, but they cannot be refused. Mr. Hollywood is smart enough to avoid harmful spaces and does not collapse Crumbled Spaces.

rulings.desc: Any Altar wishes occur at the end of the turn, after all player movement is completed.
Effects which target a stat that a token lacks have no effect on the token. For example, a space that deals damage will not affect a token who has no concept of HP.

The specific nature of combat in the case of tokens which are deficient in some stats is this. All involved players or tokens who have an ATK stat will attack all involved players or tokens who have an HP stat. All such attacks happen simultaneously, and in general a token will never attack itself unless otherwise stated.

In general, an action which attempts to move into a gap is considered to be a mistake or a typo, and the player will not be allowed to move into the gap. If the movement into the gap was intentional, this should be specified in the post. This ruling does not apply if the player in question has any equipment that would enable him or her to pass the gaps without the normal penalty.

The larger the magnitude of a wish, the less likely it is to end up in the wisher's favor. That is, a simple wish is likely to go exactly as intended. A large and complicated wish may be interpreted extremely literally and the results may not be what was desired.
